FuncDef:
The discovery-pmtu-max command specifies the maximum path MTU that a path MTU test instance can check.
The undo discovery-pmtu-max command restores the default maximum path MTU that a path MTU test instance can check.
By default, the maximum path MTU that a path MTU test instance can check is 1500 bytes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum path MTU that a path MTU test instance can check.
The value is an integer ranging from 48 to 9198, in bytes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the path MTU test scenario, if you want to measure the maximum detection range of the path MTU, run the discovery-pmtu-max-num command to set the maximum detection range for the path MTU test.
Prerequisites
The discovery-pmtu-max command is available only for a path MTU test instance.
Precautions
If parameters need to be changed during the running of the test instance, the system prompts you whether to terminate the test instance. Press "Y" or "N" as required.
If you press "Y", the test instance is terminated and parameters changed. The changed parameters take effect after the commit command is run. To restart the test instance, run the start command.If you press "N", the test instance keeps running, and the parameters fail to be modified.
